meanings.definition: A person or thing that allures or entices.
meanings.sent1: The allurer at the fair had a table full of shiny prizes.
meanings.sent2: The new toy was a great allurer for the children.
meanings.sent3: The allurer, a colorful bird, sang a sweet melody to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The allurer of the forest, a sparkling stream, beckoned travelers to its cool waters.
meanings.sent5: The allurer, a delicious smell, wafted from the bakery and drew in customers.

meanings.definition: To attract or tempt by something desirable.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object allurered the magpie from its nest.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of freshly baked cookies allurered the children into the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The clever salesman allurered customers with promises of great deals.
meanings.sent4: The siren song of the mermaid allurered sailors to their doom.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city allurered the young artist seeking inspiration.
